trans-unit.source: Add Web API code
trans-unit.target: Add Web API code

trans-unit.source: In the following steps you add code for a simple HTTP Get method that returns a hard-coded list of contacts.
trans-unit.target: In the following steps you add code for a simple HTTP Get method that returns a hard-coded list of contacts.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the **Models** folder and select **Add > Class**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the **Models** folder and select **Add > Class**.

trans-unit.source: Name the new file *Contact.cs*.
trans-unit.target: Name the new file *Contact.cs*.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Once the *Contact.cs* file has been created, replace the entire contents of the file with the following code.
trans-unit.target: Once the *Contact.cs* file has been created, replace the entire contents of the file with the following code.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the **Controllers** folder, and select **Add > Controller**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the **Controllers** folder, and select **Add > Controller**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add Scaffold** dialog, select the **Web API 2 Controller - Empty** option, and click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add Scaffold** dialog, select the **Web API 2 Controller - Empty** option, and click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Name the controller **ContactsController**, and click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Name the controller **ContactsController**, and click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Once the ContactsController.cs file has been created, replace the entire contents of the file with the following code.
trans-unit.target: Once the ContactsController.cs file has been created, replace the entire contents of the file with the following code.

trans-unit.source: Enable Swagger UI
trans-unit.target: Enable Swagger UI

trans-unit.source: By default, API App projects are enabled with automatic [Swagger](http://swagger.io/ "Official Swagger information") metadata generation, and when you use the **Add API App SDK** menu entry to convert a Web API project, an API test page is also enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: By default, API App projects are enabled with automatic [Swagger](http://swagger.io/ "Official Swagger information") metadata generation, and when you use the **Add API App SDK** menu entry to convert a Web API project, an API test page is also enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: However, the Azure API App new-project template disables the API test page.
trans-unit.target: However, the Azure API App new-project template disables the API test page.

trans-unit.source: When you create your API app project by using the API app project template, do the following steps to enable the test page.
trans-unit.target: When you create your API app project by using the API app project template, do the following steps to enable the test page.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** If you deploy the API app as *public anonymous* and with the Swagger UI enabled, anyone will be able to use the Swagger UI to discover and call your APIs.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** If you deploy the API app as *public anonymous* and with the Swagger UI enabled, anyone will be able to use the Swagger UI to discover and call your APIs.

trans-unit.source: Open the *App_Start/SwaggerConfig.cs* file, and search for **EnableSwaggerUI**:
trans-unit.target: Open the *App_Start/SwaggerConfig.cs* file, and search for **EnableSwaggerUI**:

trans-unit.source: Uncomment the following lines of code:
trans-unit.target: Uncomment the following lines of code:

trans-unit.source: When you're done, the file should look like this:
trans-unit.target: When you're done, the file should look like this:

trans-unit.source: Test the Web API
trans-unit.target: Test the Web API

trans-unit.source: To view the API test page, perform the following steps.
trans-unit.target: To view the API test page, perform the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Run the app locally (CTRL+F5).
trans-unit.target: Run the app locally (CTRL+F5).

trans-unit.source: The browser opens and displays an HTTP 403 error because the base URL is not a valid web page or API method URL for this project.
trans-unit.target: The browser opens and displays an HTTP 403 error because the base URL is not a valid web page or API method URL for this project.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Swagger page by adding `/swagger` to the end of the base URL.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Swagger page by adding `/swagger` to the end of the base URL.

trans-unit.source: Click **Contacts > Get > Try it out**, and you see that the API is functioning and returns the expected result.
trans-unit.target: Click **Contacts > Get > Try it out**, and you see that the API is functioning and returns the expected result.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio click **Debug > Stop Debugging**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio click **Debug > Stop Debugging**.
